page.title: 09THE SOUTH COMMON
page.content: The South Common was replanted last Year (1984) after much discussion with the local Community Council. The conflict arose bbbecause of the needs of the scenic amenity of the area and the financial income available from timber. The financial advantages ofplanting with conifer were outweighed by the need to maintain the area as a local recreational facility. The heather had become over mature and the whin was threatening the general appearance of the whole area. The planting was therefore done with beech, ash, oak, hazel, birch, blackthorn, holly, scots pine, and rowan(mountain ash).
